bibl.title: Letter from William L. Lazear to Charlotte C. Lazear, December 22, 1866

div1.p: William Lazear writes that his mother's health is improving.

div1.head: Letter from William L. Lazear to Charlotte C. Lazear, December 22, 1866
div1.opener:
S. P. SHRIVER.
J. B. LAZEAR.
Office of Shriver & Lazear,
Wholesale Grocers,
Nos. 27 & 29 SMITHFIELD STREET,
Pittsburgh, Dec 22 1866
3 P.M.
My Darling Wife
div1.p:
I reached here as
pleasantly as I expected at half past
one o'clock -- Found a dispatch
from Jim to Francis saying Mother
was a little better at noon today
Dr Jones, who went with Jim & Tom has
hopes of her recovery

The Boats stopped running today
so I have try the overland route --

-- I feel no soreness from my throat
or any traces of my recent cold

Love to Ma darling little Jesse
and your dear self
